user_question: If a tardigrade were the size of a human, how much more resistant to radiation would it be compared to a human?
final_answer: Tardigrades are known to withstand radiation levels up to 5,000 Gy, whereas humans can only survive up to about 5 Gy. If a tardigrade were the size of a human, it would still be approximately 1,000 times more resistant to radiation than a human.
